descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language. It is the language for HTML and all modern browsers. It gives journalists the power to add interactivity, build applications, and retrieve data, among other uses. This course introduces students to JavaScript coding with an eye toward narrative. Students will learn the basics of interactive storytelling through an in-depth study of nonlinear narrative structure in the media today, while learning to build their own stories during hands-on web-development labs. Knowledge of HTML and CSS is required.
